item.title: Zyxel won’t patch newly exploited flaws in end-of-life routers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Zyxel has issued a security advisory about actively exploited flaws in CPE Series devices, warning that it has no plans to issue fixing patches and urging users to move to actively supported models. [...]

item.title: Google Play, Apple App Store apps caught stealing crypto wallets
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new campaign dubbed 'SparkCat' has been uncovered, targeting the cryptocurrency wallet recovery phrases of Android and iOS users using optical character recognition (OCR) stealers. [...]

item.title: Cyber agencies share security guidance for network edge devices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Five Eyes cybersecurity agencies in the UK, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and the U.S. have issued guidance urging makers of network edge devices and appliances to improve forensic visibility to help defenders detect attacks and investigate breaches. [...]

item.title: Chinese cyberspies use new SSH backdoor in network device hacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A Chinese hacking group is hijacking the SSH daemon on network appliances by injecting malware into the process for persistent access and covert operations. [...]

item.title: Netgear warns users to patch critical WiFi router vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Netgear has fixed two critical remote code execution and authentication bypass vulnerabilities affecting multiple WiFi routers and warned customers to update their devices to the latest firmware as soon as possible. [...]

item.title: California man steals $50 million using fake investment sites, gets 7 years
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A 59-year-old man from Irvine, California, was sentenced to 87 months in prison for his involvement in an investor fraud ring that stole $50 million between 2012 and October 2020. [...]

item.title: How hackers target your Active Directory with breached VPN passwords
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: As the gateways to corporate networks, VPNs are an attractive target for attackers. Learn from Specops Software about how hackers use compromised VPN passwords and how you can protect your organization. [...]

item.title: 7-Zip MotW bypass exploited in zero-day attacks against Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A 7-Zip vulnerability allowing attackers to bypass the Mark of the Web (MotW) Windows security feature was exploited by Russian hackers as a zero-day since September 2024. [...]

item.title: GrubHub data breach impacts customers, drivers, and merchants
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Food delivery company GrubHub disclosed a data breach impacting the personal information of an undisclosed number of customers, merchants, and drivers after attackers breached its systems using a service provider account. [...]

item.title: First Apple-notarized porn app available to iPhone users in Europe
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The first Apple-notarized porn app, "Hot Tub," is now available to iPhone users in Europe through the alternative app marketplace, AltStore PAL. [...]

item.title: Amazon Redshift gets new default settings to prevent data breaches
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Amazon has announced key security enhancements for Redshift, a popular data warehousing solution, to help prevent data exposures due to misconfigurations and insecure default settings. [...]

item.title: Google fixes Android kernel zero-day exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The February 2025 Android security updates patch 48 vulnerabilities, including a zero-day kernel vulnerability that has been exploited in the wild. [...]

item.title: Canadian charged with stealing $65 million using DeFI crypto exploits
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Justice Department has charged a Canadian man with stealing roughly $65 million after exploiting two decentralized finance (DeFI) protocols. [...]

item.title: Casio UK online store hacked to steal customer credit cards
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Casio UK's e-shop at casio.co.uk was hacked to include malicious scripts that stole credit card and customer information between January 14 and 24, 2025. [...]
